page.description: Prompts for a filter expression. If table_set_name is not specified, current table/set is used. Table_set_name can be a crlf delimited list of tables.
page.syntax: Expression as C = ui_get_filter([C title [,C prompt [,C default [,C table_set_name ]]]])

argument.name: Expression
argument.description: A character filter expression that evaluates to a logical value and selects records from the table or set.

argument.name: title
argument.description: Optional. Default = "". The title of the dialog box.

argument.name: prompt
argument.description: Optional. Default = "". The prompt inside the dialog box.

argument.name: default
argument.description: Optional. Default = "". The default value to display for the filter expression.

argument.name: table_set_name
argument.description: Optional. Default = current table or set. The table to use to evaluate the filter expression. Table_Set_Name may be a CR-LF delimited list of tables.

page.discussion: The UI_GET_FILTER() function prompts for a filter expression. If the Table_Set_Name is not provided, it uses the current table or set. Clicking on the icon displays the Expression Builder dialog box.
page.example: dim prmpt_title as C dim prmpt_prompt as C dim prmpt_default as C dim prmpt_tables as C dim shared cFilter as C prmpt_title = "Enter a Filter Expression" prmpt_prompt = "Enter a filter expression that evaluates to a character value" prmpt_default = "" prmpt_tables = "customer" cFilter = ui_get_filter(prmpt_title,prmpt_prompt,prmpt_default,prmpt_tables)
